{"step_by_step_thinking": "Based on the information provided, the woman is at 20 weeks of pregnancy and presents with bleeding per vaginum. On speculum examination, the os is open but no products have come out. This presentation is consistent with an inevitable abortion. In an inevitable abortion, the cervix is open and there is vaginal bleeding, but the products of conception have not yet been expelled. Incomplete abortion refers to a partial expulsion of the pregnancy tissue, while complete abortion refers to a complete loss of products of conception. Missed abortion refers to a nonviable pregnancy in which the products of conception are retained within the uterus without any symptoms of bleeding. Therefore, the most likely diagnosis in this case is C. Inevitable abortion.", "answer_choice": "C"}
